website_summaries.verdict: An exceptionally popular clothing rack dedicated to a simple, high-quality construction.
pros: Metal rack collapses for easy portability and storage
Customers appreciate the extending top rack, allowing for extra hanging space
cons: Some buyers found the "heavy duty" description as a bit misleading

customer_reviews.title: I got the idea to hang my jeans like I do at work and the rolling rack fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I needed more room and space for my clothes. Since I work in retail, I got the idea to hang my jeans like I do at work and the rolling rack fit all my jeans. I might just order another one for my t shirts
customer_reviews.author: HeyRob

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was super easy (I didn't use the wheels since I won't be moving mine). It's extremely sturdy I have most of my wardrobe hanging on it now without any issue. Height and size is perfect for my space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Far from heavy duty, its barely adequate for static seasonal storage. Loose tolerances makes it tippy and off balance so it stands next to a wall. I'll be shopping for an alternate style for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: SirWillYum

customer_reviews.title: mmm, not quite 'heavy' duty.
customer_reviews.text: I’m giving it 4stars because it’s not heavy duty. Let’s be honest here. Medium duty would be more accurate, but I knew that going in from the other reviews. It’s a decent rack, great for the money, easy to assemble and hold my 35 shirts. It’s good enough for me. If they were honest in the description regarding the 'heavy' duty, I would’ve given 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ed E

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! it's easy to setup and sturdy! Love it would order another one.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine G.

customer_reviews.title: Oh Yeah, buy it!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a drapery business, has had for nealy 3 decades, and my only regret about this rack is that we didn't buy it YEARS ago! It is solid, well built, and went together like a dream. Most of the set up is accomplished with the "push in the little knob thingy and find the right place to let it pop out again" (Don't you love savvy technical reviews???); only the wheels bolt on. It is just terrific in its design and utility - you can fold it up for storage or transport to an installation. The price was extremely reasonable, and I would buy one again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry A. Confer

customer_reviews.title: It is very sturdy and currently holds over 50 hangers and even more ...
customer_reviews.text: I'd previously been using a cheaper clothes rack for the majority of my clothes (since my room does not have a closet right now) but it crashed all over the place! This was worth the price which was still affordable. It is very sturdy and currently holds over 50 hangers and even more pieces of clothes! Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Myers

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The parts to attach the wheels are not in the box. *update* They sent all new wheels that do not match what I bought. 🤦🏻‍♀️ *update 2* They couldn’t figure out how the replacement wheels didn’t fit...so they sent me a whole new rack. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: These racks are amazing! Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: These racks are amazing! Easy to use, collapse easily and fit into a suitcase. I use one of them s a dolly to carry around my market display. I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Branimira Ivanova

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The frame is a bit wobbly and the ends are clearly not up to the challenge of holding garments which is the whole reason I bought the clothes rack. I use it for hanging up clothes that I've washed on the delicate cycle and wont dry in the dryer. One end arrived bent /loose and the wheels are not very well made. I just moved and needed this desperately so I'm not inclined to send it back but don't think it's worth the money spent. Update***company is very proactive and sent me a replacement when I complained. Unfortunately, it's still not well constructed but they have excellent customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Luna

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. Horrible quality.
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made. If you try and wheel it around with clothes on them they will tip over. Rods that make it longer get stuck and won’t come out. when you hang clothing to the end of the rods they bend. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Alma

customer_reviews.title: Good for my Coats
customer_reviews.text: I needed a clothing rack for my winter coats & jackets. I have so many LOL. This was super easy to assemble. Everything clicks into one another except for the wheels (which I did not use) I put about 15 coats and it seems to be sturdy. Not sure if the price was worth it. Quality is okay. I will need a second one but gonna price around for something cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: CatrineTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty well made rack
customer_reviews.text: I use this rack to hang inventory before adding to my boutique. This rack is heavy duty, well constructed and glides easily. Super easy to assemble and has no support issues when fully loaded with garments. I recommend this to anyone who needs extra hanging space.
customer_reviews.author: Lesli

customer_reviews.title: Portable & Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Collapses flat so easy to put away. The pieces move around so I just used the plastic wrap (home depot) and it makes it 10x easier to store, so when I want to use it I just pull the wrap off and wrap it again when I am done. The picture is of my storage closet and the garment rack takes up 3-1/2 inches of storage (depth) did not measure length or width, also in the photo is the roll of plastic wrap I use.
customer_reviews.author: isldgrl2008

customer_reviews.title: Not a commercial garment rack
customer_reviews.text: Not commercial quality as advertised. Looks similar, but missing the torque support on the bottom braces because the bars snap together instead of the solid commercial ones. Don't put too much weight on this item and try to move it over carpet. It will twist up and fall apart. Safety hazard around small children!
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Good Product Easy Assembly
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this purchase. It was quick and easy to put together. I would not say it is "heavy duty" however. The pull out extender arms are not solid or sturdy, but they work for light items. I love the wheels, but be aware they do not lock. For the price, I think it is a good product. I got it to hang clothes on to dry and it does the job nicely. I like that I can move it easily from indoors to outdoors and it is lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: mu

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I have a huge amount of clothing, too much for my closet alone. This gives me all the extra space I need! I love how the rack expands on the ends to create even more space.
customer_reviews.author: elizabethpowell

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy! This is just what we needed to put in a closet space that doesn't have any built-in rods. The old one fell apart regularly. This one is a snap to put together, holds plenty, and is solid. Good price for the quality, too.
customer_reviews.author: elsie3

customer_reviews.title: TOTAL JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I've indicated "one star," but the one I received deserves NO STARS. When it arrived, I knew it would be trouble because of the small box. One of the two angled uprights would not move at all, and the weld gave way under moderate pressure. This was truly depressing, because the integrity of the entire rack depends on the angled uprights engagement with the upper parts. Others have mentioned the flimsy, quasi-industrial grade nature of this piece of junk. It sways and shimmies like a cobra on crack. Didn't bother to contact the vendor, too many hassles as described by others.
customer_reviews.author: Socrates

customer_reviews.title: The room we set them up in now smells like fuel, as well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these. They came in boxes that we destroyed and after setting up the racks they wreak of gasoline. The room we set them up in now smells like fuel, as well. No idea how that happened but these are not even useable. I can't hang my clothing on something that smells like fuel.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Webb

customer_reviews.title: but would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy material. Will still use it, but would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JAF

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I've already taken it to three vendor events
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I've already taken it to three vendor events. The only thing I wish it had was the little clips to clip the top bar onto the frame when you are transporting it. My other one has this and it's just slightly more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Not commercial grade!
customer_reviews.text: This rack is not what I would call commercial grade. It is very flimsy and lightweight. I thought I was getting something that I could roll around on different grounds without difficulty. Not so, I can barely roll this rack around on packed sand without having a tipping problem. I use these at shows and thought I was getting a heavier duty rack. This is nothing more than a rack you would use in a laundry room without moving it around. I would not recommend this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: A great way to hang up clothing when there isn't closet space
customer_reviews.text: I was a little nervous purchasing this item dew to the many negative reviews. My nervousness was unfounded. The box had everything needed to assemble the clothing rack, the instructions were easy to follow and it was easy to assemble by myself. I have filled all the space in between the two vertical bars and the unit hasn't bent, bowed or fallen over. None of the welds has given and it is still easy to push and/or pull around. I would happily recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: That guy with the mustache

customer_reviews.title: Functional, but poorly assembled.
customer_reviews.text: I perform with a singing group requiring multiple changes of clothing. This rack allows me to hang the clothes in an orderly fashion. Basically, the clothing rack works as advertised. Since it is meant to be easily assembled, a sturdy bag to house and carry the unit would be great. Assembly is not very easy because the chrome piping does not slip into other piping without some effort. Also, in the factory assembly of the chrome piping, one of the pipes was welded backwards making it impossible to click the two pipes together because the hole for the nipple is now on the wrong side.
customer_reviews.author: Charles R Roots

customer_reviews.title: The rack was a great size, but broke the first time I used ...
customer_reviews.text: The rack was a great size, but broke the first time I used it. I have tried to contact the company multiple times, through email and the phone number listed, but have not received any feedback. I can not give them a good review at this time, due to the way the product held up and the way they are conducting their business
customer_reviews.author: Brian Olson

customer_reviews.title: Durable, Attractive, and Functional
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before ordering this garment rack. I needed a durable, easy-to-assemble rack I could fit into my small space entry. To my pleased surprise, the rack was very easy to assemble. I had planned to use the wheels, which looked substantial, but it wasn't necessary. The rack was tested when 8 people came over on a cold morning and filled the rack with coats and bags. No problem. This garment rack is attractive with its chrome finish and the diameter of the frame does seem larger than usual. It fits the small space perfectly and I have been using it for my outerwear ever since I put it up. My tiny entryway is transformed.
customer_reviews.author: bookcat

customer_reviews.title: Small, Sturdy and Functional
customer_reviews.text: This rack is very sturdy and I love the fact it has wheels so you can move it around when necessary. It's smaller than I realized when ordering, but it's a great rack that holds a nice amount of stuff. I also like the extended arms as it can be used to hang more clothes or great to hang purses at the end. I have over 40 items hanging on the bar and 5 purses on each extended arm and so far so good. This great for small spaces.
customer_reviews.author: MsPraise

customer_reviews.title: LIGHT DUTY  ONLY
customer_reviews.text: The rack is described as heavy duty. It isn't. It is a fairly light duty rack for home use. I would not recommend it for holding much weight either. There was one surprising thing that causes me to give it a higher rating than "0" and that is how easily it assembles and comes apart. The rack goes together with poles that click lock together. They are fairly easy to take apart. This makes it easy to take the rack apart and hide if you need to hide it, but taking it apart is not something you would do regularly. I found useful for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing :(
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for overflow from my closet and prep packing for vacation. When it arrived, the box had a hole in the corner. I decided to open the box because the item was metal and probably not damaged. As I began assembling, I noticed several areas of damage. One of the poles was pinched, the end of the extender bar cap was bent, and one of the poles wouldn’t properly slide into the other without major force. I decided to return it without having it replaced. I gave it a 4 star on assembly because it was simple to put together for the most part. Wish it could have worked out.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: not really, really heavy-duty but works for normal rack of clothes. Many hangars of sweaters would overwhelm this rack. All-metal, slides together and spring-snaps in place. I did not use the provided wheels, but have kept them 'in case.' this is a really nice rack, not good for 20 heavy coats but very solid with 15- 20 blouses/shirts, 10 bluejeans, and a shoeshelf that is full. I like it, and would order another if I did not plan on building a wooden closet with rod and shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy Two

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy item ridiculously easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Over the 65 years of my life I’ve assembled hundreds of items. This was the easiest to assemble - ever! Assembly takes 5-10 minutes max. Most pieces snap together. He casters have a lock washer and nut with a small wrench included. Also a spare lock washer and nut were provide in their own package. This is very sturdy. My previous one had plastic parts which ended in breaking. I purchased two of these and they are excellent for the price. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph A. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not efficient for retail use.
customer_reviews.text: This rack is super cheap. The overall frame was bent from the box and made it wobbly. I thought it would be ok with some weight on it. The extra weight just makes it harder to move and wants to fall being that it is too heavy. I have had it fall once when it was full of clothing. Even if you need a rack for just a few pieces of clothing, it still wobbles. Easy to assemble though and if you just need it for your home to put a few pieces on and not move around, then it might be fine. . I do not recommend this rack.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Dailey

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW! This is horrible do not waste your money. I wrote my first review after having clothes hanging stationary in my home, however I recently tried to move the rack and it completely twisted and feel over! Upon picking up all the clothes that feel off, I realized the pole actually bent and twisted from the bottom frame! I had to dump it. Very cheap and not worth your money. It gets the job done if you don't have to transport. However if you are needing to transport clothes I would not recommend, as it is not that sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Heather L Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Not quite as advertised
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Good for toddler clothes. Easy to assemble. The amazon return policy. CONS: Not very sturdy, smaller than advertised, arrived with incorrect pieces that didn't interlock. Purchased a few heavy duty clothes racks from another brand & was hoping these would be similar. These will tip over with coats, mens suits or any heavy garment. I knew this wasn't going to be good when the small box arrived. Like a home verson of what you see in stores but NOT the same quality or durability.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Martin

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: From the reviews, I expected this to be above or at least average quality. I bought this to hang up my husband's clothes, but it is not sturdy enough to hold that kind of weight. I would recommend this for light clothing (women's summer clothing or kid's clothing), but not winter coats or even a lot of sweaters. And even though it has the extendable bars on each side, it is really on the smaller side in terms of capacity. I'm looking for another one now that can withstand heavier clothing and hold more of it. I expected something much better.
customer_reviews.author: BuddhaBelly

customer_reviews.title: This is my second of the same item
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty sturdy and holds a lot of clothing for my online store... for some reason this seems to be slightly, "tippy" than my other from the same manufacturer. I might take it apart and put it back together to see if it was me or it's just a small snaffoo? It does hold a lot of clothing, but you need to place the more heavy items in the center and not on the extensions which is obvious I suppose.
customer_reviews.author: TravelerTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: buy!
customer_reviews.text: stop reading reviews and just buy it! super easy to put together, and holds so many clothes!!!! I moved into a new apartment that had no closets, and I have SO much clothes, I bought a cheaper version of this from a different store and it was hard to put together, and fell apart after like 10 items of clothes. the is super heavy duty and amazing. will re buy if I ever need to! highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Curious Kash

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money on this rack.
customer_reviews.text: The rack is advertised as commercial but it does not hold up to commercial expectations. The rod extensions are very hard to extend and most annoying there is a two part metal bar that the will not allow hangers to slide evenly over the span of the rod. I put in a closet where it does need to work hard.and next time, I will spend a few bucks more and get the rel commercial grade. This has been a waste of my hard earned, resale shop earnings.
customer_reviews.author: Ro S

customer_reviews.title: Crooked. Bolts don’t fit the wheels. Lousy quality.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not worth the cost. In the beginning I thought it seemed easy to assemble but when I finished assembling it was all crooked. When I tried to install the wheels they kept falling out because the bolts included were a different size from the wheels screws. Terrible manufacturing. Will give it a chance for a couple of days but probably will end up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W.

customer_reviews.title: Gasoline smells and not a commercial grade stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is not a commercial grade as described. Be ware an extremely chemical smell! I'm so upset with a unhealthy gasoline smell on products! What kind of stuff did you use to clean? I hate a seller doesn't care about buyer's health!! I wanted to return right away because it gives me a headache and making me a vomit!!! I tried to wipe off using a febrize but gasoline odor is still giving off my entire house! This is a used one, please don't try to make it a new look using a unhealthy chemical stuff! I'm not overreacting! I'm very serious!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Lady

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was doubtful when I opened the box, but as the cart took shape I was surprised by how rigid it actually is. Assembly is easy, but watch out for pinching as you slide the parts together. I don't think I'd try to roll it on carpet fully loaded, but it will support a full bar of clothes. I'd recommend placing the heaviest clothes closer to the vertical supports.
customer_reviews.author: J. Deuel

customer_reviews.title: Tough if you are mobile as there are lots of parts
customer_reviews.text: This is a really well built rack and great if you are putting it up and leaving it up or using it rarely. I need to have a rack that I put up and down a lot and this end up in five pieces that don't have any way of staying together unless you use the box. I find I'm constantly trying to keep track of all of the pieces. While it's a good rack, it's too tough for constant vending. I'm going to resell it and buy a different one.
customer_reviews.author: LizT

customer_reviews.title: This product remains put together. I don't dare take ...
customer_reviews.text: This product remains put together. I don't dare take it apart as it was difficult to put together and take apart on 2 other occassions. I planned to use for selling clothing at holiday bazaars and similar events. It is dependably strong enough as noted in ad. It is just difficult to put together and take apart several times. You may want to have a space large enough to keep it stored if you only plan to use once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Very rickety and easily over-turned
customer_reviews.text: These are NOT HEAVY DUTY! CAVEAT EMPTOR!!!!! Easy to assemble and load up only to have them overturn due to instability! I bought two and they suck! I will give them away (wasted money) when I find some that are actually what they say, "Heavy Duty". They are made in Taiwan so had that little gem been made easily available to the buying public, I would never have purchased them!
customer_reviews.author: Chatilingus

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and also very easy to store away.
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you need more closet space and have a place to store this device. I returned mine because I bought a beautiful dresser set from Amazon. As far as the portable closet it was extremely Easy to assemble and also to store away. I highly recommend this one and I had looked at several ones before.
customer_reviews.author: William Horstman

customer_reviews.title: It's good, but not "Commercial grade"
customer_reviews.text: This is a functional clothing rack. However, the "commercial grade" label is misleading. This rack would not work well in any industrial or commercial facility. It's not very sturdy, especially when fully loaded. A commercial rack would be single-piece welded or bolted together. The pieces for this rack fit together with spring-loaded clips, which makes it very easy to ship and assemble, but not very solid. The wheels are plastic, not rubber, but they do roll and turn easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy construction, easily assembled, HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.text: I had expected this to be "wobbly" since it was so easy to assemble. The tubes fit together snugly without binding and were a cinch to put together. The wheels had to be bolted on but a small wrench was provided so no tools were needed. Once assembled, the rack can be extended with rods that pull out from the larger tubes, These won't hold the same weight as the main body of the rack but for our purposes are perfect. The cart rolls easily when needing to be re-positioned.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this expecting a headache when I put it together. We wanted to hang heavy winter coats on it and I this product description made me believe it would be sufficient for that use. I open the packaging, cut off five zip ties, and literally popped it together and less than two minutes. I now have three of them as they come in super handy. Never again will I buy one of these at Target or some other department store. Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: The extension that pulls out on the end of each rack.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the product is fast and easy to assemble. The product is used for our Church Community Event where 200 - 300 people show up for free clothes. Most of the donated clothes and shoes are brand new. We organize and put most of the clothes in size order which makes it easier to find for the people. Every year we purchase two more racks. We are up to 6 racks now.
customer_reviews.author: SDiane Durham

customer_reviews.title: Bought as an appreciation gift!
customer_reviews.text: Friends visited our home and the wife saw my rolling garment rack. She flipped. They were very helpful to us while they visited. We sent them one as an appreciation gift. They are very pleased. I would buy again for either of our households. I have used it to create 'hang to dry' rack in the laundry room, to move loads of clothes to temp apartment and then to home after construction. Folds flat and stows under a bed or along side appliances but I have kept mine up most of the time. It also services as a guest coat or garment rack. Versatile.
customer_reviews.author: GAcamelia

customer_reviews.title: For the money, good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: These came in a smaller than expected package, but expanded and assembled they are true to the measurements given. They (we have more than one) hold a full rack of suits, dresses, etc. without any apparent bending or stresses. The extension on the end is a nice feature as you can make "the rack" bigger or smaller for sorting chores. I wouldn't move these much, however, as nothing short of welded racks can take much movement over uneven floors or carpet. Generally up to the task and nice looking enough with the chrome finish. For the price, you can't go far wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlandsman

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much I bought another!!
customer_reviews.text: Moved in with my boyfriend. Needed clothes rack space. This fit the bill perfectly!! So easy to assemble. So sturdy. And I have A LOT of clothes.... Roll really nicely too. Highly highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: pmprdmom

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble, and spacious garment rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this garment rack so I could have a place to hang all of my midi and maxi dresses as my California closets don't really accommodate the length of these dresses for me. The garment rack is so easy to setup and is very sturdy and stable. The one small detail I gave it 4 stars for is that it is actually pretty short in height. I'm 5'5'' and my maxi dresses hit the floor and fold over a few inches in height, so this rack is definitely on the shorter side. I'm still happy with my purchase and don't have issues with the mobility of the rack even with the dresses that are too long for it.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good.
customer_reviews.text: I like you don't need tools for the assembly. What I had difficulty with is that I have arthritis and severe Fibromyalgia. The forcing together of poles to lock in place with my own strength was very difficult for me. Also, this rack is somewhat less durable than I thought it would be, therefore less can be hung on it. Overall, it's pretty good. I just worry about the taking apart aspect when it's time to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Petit Trianon

customer_reviews.title: Drunken clothes rack.
customer_reviews.text: It works and was cheap, so I'm glad I bought it, but the wheels are just a tease because it's not structural enough to be pushed except down low at your feet. Just be careful moving w/ clothes hanging on it and start movement using your feet, not hands. Then it will provide years of moderately humorous use.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this cheaply made rack
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this thinking I was getting a heavy duty, commercial grade rack. The wheels are heavy duty/commercial grade. The rest of it is very disappointing in quality and strength. The pull-out end bars sag under their own weight when they are half extended. See my photo where the newly assembled rack's end bar is sagging under the weight of empty hangers. You can buy a significantly better quality item that is identical in design at the 🎯 store for the same price, and you'll be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ian411Ian

customer_reviews.title: Easily assembled, sturdy and easily moved
customer_reviews.text: My walk in closet floor was soaked by a water leak in a next door bathroom so I needed to get my clothes out quickly but have them easily available. I was concerned that this garment rack might be flimsy and/or difficult to assemble or move. None of those three things turned out to be accurate. It is beyond sturdy. I timed the assembly and it took me 6 minutes (follow the clear directions in the enclosed pictures) and after I hung a huge number of heavy clothes on hangers it moved easily on large rollers from room to room in my house. Its a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Spring loaded locking pin would not engage...
customer_reviews.text: ...on the bottom portion of the rack. So it won't stand up to hold the clothing. When trying to lock it properly, then the pin fell into the tube when pushing it in to lock and now it won't come out. I'm not that strong to have pushed the locking pin so forcefully that it won't come out of the tube anymore. Now I have to jerry rig this with zip ties in order for it to stand upright. Not a good product.
customer_reviews.author: LaToya Ambrose - Good Reads

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface I did return this item because I needed sturdier rack. Before I even put this rack together I notice the pieces weren’t straight but I still put it together hoping it would work itself out. Unfortunately, that was not the case. The rack was uneven so one wheel was always off the ground even after trying the bend it back. The other thing I wasn’t thrilled with is the extenders could be easily pulled out because there is nothing stopping them from being removed. What a pain in the butt if you had clothes hanging on the extender but didn’t realize you didn’t have room left.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Pasha

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and great to use
customer_reviews.text: I set up this in my garage to hold some coat I wear outside at this pandemic time but is not good to wash after every use. This is very easy to assemble and great size (in width and height, good to fit my space). The only reason I gave 4 stars is that the middle welded support rack looks a little bit weak. I managed to lift it without broken the welding. Otherwise, the quality is good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: XC

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and I was utterly happy when I put clothes on it, rolled it, and it didn’t collapse like the last piece of garbage I bought. It certainly helps there are no plastic holding it together. It held all I needed (I did leave jeans off of it as they are so heavy and I was apprehensive). Rolls easily and holds a lot. If anything happens later, I’ll revise my review, but good so far!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Defective bottom racks, not locking into place.
customer_reviews.text: Installation is very straight forward and easy. All you have to do is make sure the items "click" into place. For the most part, all of them do click and stay in place. The only flawed area is the bottom rack where the wheels are at. Only one out of 4 click together. Therefore, the rest will move around more freely because it's not secured into one spotI'm not sure if it's a defective item or... i just got unlucky.. Other than that, it seems to be working well.
customer_reviews.author: DEE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: This was super easy to assemble. Only takes a few minutes. I listened to another reviewers advice and just left the wheels off. I bought the heavy duty one and I have about 60 shirts on there (sn-2x) and I haven’t had any issues with it tipping or anything like that. Idk if adding the wheels would make it more top heavy though. But if you’re not gonna be moving it around much definitely just leave the wheels off. You can always add em on later if your situation changes and you need to move it often.
customer_reviews.author: Angi

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: After my last clothes rack broke, I ordered this one. The quality is very good, and it has held up nicely. I forgot to write a review when I initially received it, but it is very strong and can hold a lot of clothes. The only draw back for me, is I really didn’t realize how y’all it was, that’s my fault, but I have severe arthritis in my shoulders, spine etc. so I sit while doing laundry, and hanging the clothes up from a seated position is truly impossible for me. That is probably not an issue for most people, and my rating reflects that. It is still a wonderful tool I use to get my housework done.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Foster

customer_reviews.title: Not so heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Simple design, easy to put together. Not heavy duty. I was going to replace my old clothes rack for this one. After assembling this new one, I will use it in my laundry room instead. If you plan on hanging heavy items like winter jackets/coats, you won't be able to hang that many without structural problems.. No where is there any type of heavy duty material used in the constructuon.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn

customer_reviews.title: Basic, but nothing special
customer_reviews.text: Price was OK, but the sturdiness is just not there. It is about 20% lighter than a prior brand I purchased. The package came unassembled and had 12 separate pieces, with NO instructions whatsoever. The rack will be functional and is useable, but there are better quality ones out there for a few dollars more (such as the SONGMATICS Clothes Rack).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the Price
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with this clothing rack! Assembly was extremely quick and easy, and it rolls around much easier than the one I bought from Target. Haven't been able to fill it with clothes yet, but I definitely plan on it in the future. This rack is perfect for anyone with limited closet space or even a college student. There's plenty of room to hang clothes and room for about 3-4 pairs of shoes at the bottom. I'd definitely recommend this because the quality is great for what you pay.
customer_reviews.author: James Isaac Neutron

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, sturdy and manuverable, these were perfect for our temporary solution.
customer_reviews.text: When our walk in closet shelves collapsed days before a trip, we didn't have time to repair the damage and install new wardrobe to hang our clothes. I ordered these racks and the next day I received them, assembled them and hung all the clothes on them. Easy to assemble, sturdy and manuverable, these were perfect for our temporary solution. They will break down for storage and will have many uses whether it be to dry wet towels near the pool or hang clothes for a garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Yu

customer_reviews.title: Super sturdy and good value! Very glad I purchased
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, I had a different rack that torqued out of shape due to the weight. I put those clothes plus more and coats on this rack (I just counted and have 50 items hanging plus 3 coats) and it holds them perfectly without any problems. I would recommend this rack. I put baskets between the bars below and put shoes in them. I love this rack, I was worried because, some reviews said it was not that strong, I highly disagree, great value for a sturdy little rack. Very easy to assemble and move.
customer_reviews.author: C-spikes Review

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to assemble. All the parts needed were there and the instructions easy to understand and follow. It is sturdy and reasonably priced. I would recommend it! I needed it for my 1800's period clothing, and there is no closet space in our extra room where I keep this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C. Dafler

customer_reviews.title: Out of Square so unusable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the product and it was shipped Prime from a city 60 miles from mine. The product went to three different Amazon depots before "out for delivery" When we pieced the product together it was not square. The bottom did not sit flat and true on a hardwood floor. When the wheels were attached, one was 1/2" off the floor. The out of square may be a result of mishandling in shipping on it's wayward journey. It may also be due to improper warehouse storage. In either case, the packaging wasn't robust enough to withstand the Amazon supply chain. The alternative is poor manufacturing standards. Either way, I could not use it.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Rack - Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack! My daughter moved home temporarily after she graduated from college before she started her new job and needed some extra room for her clothes. I didn't want to spend a lot since it was temporary, so this was perfect! The assembly instructions were clear, and it was super easy to put together - it only took me about 15 minutes. It rolls easily and holds a lot of clothes and coats. She was happy the ends had extenders. Great sturdy, rolling rack for a value price. I would definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: BevT

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Product!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together, holds quite a bit of clothes; however, the base was a bit too wide for my closet so had to put it in my front room. My original cheap wall-hanging closet shelving collapsed, so decided to use a sturdy clothes hanging rack to replace it. The height and length of this product is great, but I didn't figure in the width of the base, which was just about 1/4" too wide. So disappointed, because it's such a great product. So much better than those cheap $20 racks.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this product it is extremely unsteady and not sturdy. There’s two extensions on either end and placing hangers without clothes on them causes the extensions to slop downword . Very dissatisfied
customer_reviews.author: Jehammer

customer_reviews.title: Great so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have no storage in my bedroom, so for years I’ve used clothes racks like this to hang stuff. My last one broke after 3 years and I decided to try this one. It took less than 10 minutes to unpackage this and put it together. I will say that I do usually use a hanging shelf for socks, leggings, etc and I think that might be too heavy so I decided against putting it on this one. Overall so far this has been worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Study enough, good height!
customer_reviews.text: You're not going to use this like a gymnast, you're going to put clothes on it. I think as long as you don't completely overload it it's fine. I bought this to clean out a closet for temporary use by a guest. It's in the garage with blankets, quilts, sport coats and other clothing hanging from it. Good height, my floor length items are not touching the ground.
customer_reviews.author: KK2009

customer_reviews.title: 2/3 Are "Okay"
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased a new home with unfinished closets, so I purchased two of them to serve in the meantime. One of them completely collapsed with clothes on it. We received a replacement that was not much better, so I didn't put it on the wheels in hopes it'd provide more stability. I'm going to end up paying for the replacement because the other broke and warped so badly I couldn't actually get it into the box to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley R.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, affordable, easy to assemble!
customer_reviews.text: This rack functions and looks identical to one I purchased at a much higher price elsewhere. I would buy this product again, I have been very happy with it, it was extremely easy to put together it is easy to break down and store. This is a very useful item for re-organizing closets or storing seasonal clothing or formal and special items or additional storage for guests. I think every home needs one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Assembly and Disassembly Is Easy
customer_reviews.text: Assembly and Disassembly Is Easy, we use this when we travel to our daughter's house and stay for extended time. We assemble it when we arrive and disassemble it and store it under the bed when we leave. When we assemble it, we don't put the wheels on it so I don't know how well it rolls when assembled and loaded. It holds a lot of cloths!!!!
customer_reviews.author: T.W.A.

customer_reviews.title: Terrific buy!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved in with my boyfriend and there's just not enough closet space for both his clothes and mine so I needed at least one garment rack. I'm so glad I chose this one!! It holds almost all my clothes and I'm not worried at all about it tipping or falling over. I was able to assemble it by myself in just a few minutes, too, which is a plus! I'll probably end up buying another one shortly so I can space things out a little bit and it not be too crowded ☺️
customer_reviews.author: chrissy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong without tipping!
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this garment organizer. I had bought others in the past and they could only take so much weight. This one not just holds the weight, you can even move it around without worrying about tipping over. Not to mention the ends extend for more hanging area. I purchased one and when I got it and saw how versital it was and put it through the tests of a busy family I got right back on and ordered another one. If you've been searching and trying to decide on this item...wait no more you've found your solution. Thank you for making my life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: A Young

customer_reviews.title: I'm probably going to get another one or two.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hang clothes for a consignment sale I'm working on. I have hundreds of items and definitely not a lot of closet space so I tried this out. I'm so happy with it. It holds a ton of clothes, it's sturdy, super easy to assemble, and it's good quality. I was worried the rods that extend at the top would be flimsy but they're not at all. I think I may order a few more.
customer_reviews.author: starshine

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this product. I was using a suspension rod in my laundry and it would always fall with the weight of what I put on it. I purchased the rack and it held all those clothes PLUS everything I MarieKondoed out of my other closets. I would highly recommend this as an extra clothes rack or storing seasonal clothes.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mikkelsen

customer_reviews.title: Totally Recommend the product!
customer_reviews.text: We got this rack because we have ran out of space in our closet. We placed the rack in the basement to hold all of our coats (as you can see from the pic). I don't recommend adding anything heavy on the portion that extends because it will bend. Overall this rack is serving the purpose I need.
customer_reviews.author: Astri

customer_reviews.title: Great for temporary hanging
customer_reviews.text: Okay, confession: I'm not hanging clothes from it. I'm using it as a frame to hold up a green screen so I can do Zoom, YouTube, etc. But, since I'm not on camera all the time, I want to put away the screen when I'm not using it. This garment rack is quick and easy to set up and take down, stores easily, and it holds the screen perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B.

customer_reviews.title: As expected. Perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what i expected. It's lightweight without being too flimsy. Good portability. Good as a temporary clothing rack or for fashion stylists but it's not ideal if you're looking for something more permanent. Lightweight and fairly easy to set up. I set it up by myself but it's easier to set up with 2 people. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: michaeljwilliams

customer_reviews.title: Holds A Lot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this garment rack to replace the one I had from Target. I know I overloaded it but it lasted quite a few years before the plastic holder split. This one is a little longer but does not take up any more space which is a plus and since it's all metal I'm thinking it will hold up longer. I have a lot of stuff hanging on it, way more than any of the pictures posted on these reviews. Pretty easy to put together and no tools required. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Hollybee

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and rolls easy with clothing!
customer_reviews.text: Appeared to be flimsy and light weight, but after I loaded it with clothes it held up very well. Sturdy and rolled easily fully loaded. Held about 60lbs of garments in woman's clothing in 3x/4x sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Jmarie

customer_reviews.title: Added Closet Hanging Space
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to add more hanging space in my closet to store off season clothes. This was a great option for me. I purchased a cover as well. I can move it out of the way if I need anything in the closet. Well built and sturdy Not super heavy duty, but certainly more than adequate for home storage.
customer_reviews.author: MGF

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for to put in our spare room to hang jackets and hoodies!!! It’s pretty sturdy I was very surprised, and very easy to put together! Has everything you need for assembly. Directions are straight forward and easy to follow. As you can see it has a lot of weight on it and it’s not bowing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Zindarella

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Needed a sturdy, movable garment rack for a yard sale. Had about 60 dresses hanging on it and it worked just fine, even with numerous customers sorting through everything. Felt very sturdy and never in danger of tipping over - a problem I've had with less expensive garment racks in the past. Very easy to assemble and disassemble for storage, and breaks down to small enough parts to make storing it very simple.
customer_reviews.author: Fiction Fan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & easy to roll
customer_reviews.text: Much sturdier than previous one with plastic parts and push-together connections at base. Not noticeably heavier, & very maneuverable. I’d give it 5 stars, except it doesn’t have a height adjustment or locking wheels. Note: because bolted, this is not collapsible for storage. Acceptable tradeoff for me.
customer_reviews.author: Teachable

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the cost, shelf on bottom is a plus!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for space saving. It breaks down quick and easy. I store it under my bed for storage when I don’t need it. I used this to hang dry clothes sometimes but have also used it as a rack for my dresses and it worked perfectly for 30+ dresses without bending. It is sturdy and I like the shelf on the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: ShiningHiker

customer_reviews.title: Good but crooked
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this product feels great. However, mine is somewhat crooked where not all four corners touch the ground. I can maneuver is a bit where it'll touch but the second I put any clothes on it or move it, then it's all crooked again. Ordering a replacement hoping this was just a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Alecs

customer_reviews.title: SIMPLE IS ALWAYS BEST
customer_reviews.text: I love this garment rack. I tried one of the fancy systems where you connect the tubes to make different configurations and I was not impressed. I decided to just go for a simple rack and it's great. The rod extends in length so you can put as little or as much as you want on it, and I actually put it in a medium sized closet that has only shelves in it and it wheeled right in. I wish I had gone with this one first.
customer_reviews.author: Marion Randall

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with results and easy assembly.
customer_reviews.text: I am 77 and wasn’t sure if I would be able to assemble this item. Instructions are simple and easy to follow and all parts fit together perfectly. Moves around easily too. Great item. I recommend this to anyone who needs the extra space for clothing/laundry room, etc.. Very satisfied with results.
customer_reviews.author: Linda G.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I Need
customer_reviews.text: We are remodeling a 1930's house that has limited closet space. It was obvious that we needed to do better storing the clothes that were out of season. We found a small area that will become a cedar-lined closet. Height is limited by a sloping roof. We ordered one and it was quickly assembled. I was very impressed how all the parts were present and the ease of assembly. I fit perfectly. I just ordered an additional one for another space we found. Originally I was planning to construct one in my shop to fit the odd space. What a savings of time and money. Thanks for the fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Wynneguy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy-to-assemble & a perfect storage solution for hanging clothes
customer_reviews.text: Currently in a temporary living situation and was in need of hanging clothes storage. Bought this due to the fact that it disassembled easily & was small to pack away. I'm so glad I bought it - it has an extendable part on either end that gives you more storage if you need it. Sturdy & easy to move - even on carpet!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: My heir apparent put it together in no time without any issues or any tools needed. He was surprised that a little wrench was added to the package with which to tighten the casters. They move well, too. It seems very sturdy. I have it loaded with my drip dry clothes with the wings extended and loaded, and it shows no sign of fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Creaky

product_meta.title: Simple Houseware Heavy Duty Clothing Garment Rack, Chrome
product_meta.description: Size:StandardSimple Houseware Heavy Duty Clothing Garment Rack - Chrome
feature_bullets: Build with Heavy Duty Steel, Elegant Chrome finish
Extensible Top Horizontal Rod from 42.5" to 66.75"

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars8,530 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
